intro: Telanthera gracilis, commonly known as the slender telanthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Telanthera gracilis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
